mn50:3.1: _paccattaṃ yoniso manasākāsi_: lit. reflected back on himself according to the origin. On [yoniso manasikāra] see [MN 2](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=mn2).
mn50:13.2: The four verbs at the end are all variants of _jhāyati_, which means “meditate”, in its original etymology (from Latin _meditatio_ from a verb _meditari_, meaning “to think, contemplate, devise, ponder”). See [“What the Jhānas Actually Are”](https://www.hillsidehermitage.org/what-the-jhanas-actually-are/) and [this follow-up writing.](https://www.reddit.com/r/HillsideHermitage/comments/1e2hztc/on_thinking_about_jh%C4%81na_by_ven_thanissaro/)
